static member CreateOrUpdateProtectedItem : Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.IProtectedItemOperations * string * string * string * string * string * Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.Models.ProtectedItemCreateOrUpdateRequest * Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.Models.CustomRequestHeaders -> Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.Models.BaseRecoveryServicesJobResponse
MemberSignature.Usage: Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.ProtectedItemOperationsExtensions.CreateOrUpdateProtectedItem (operations, resourceGroupName, resourceName, fabricName, containerName, protectedItemName, request, customRequestHeaders)

Docs.param: Required. Resource group name of your recovery services vault.
Required. Name of your recovery services vault.
Required. Fabric name of the protected item.
Required. Name of the container where the protected item belongs to.
Required. Name of the protected item which has to be backed up.
Docs.summary: The Create Or Update Protected Item Operation is used to enable protection of an item within a container or to modify the protection of an already protected item. In the case of enable protection, this operation creates a new protected item entity in the backend service. In the case of modify protection, this operation updates the already created entity in the backend service. This is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether the backend service has finished processing the request, call the Get Item Operation Result API.
Docs.returns: Base recovery job response for all the asynchronous operations.

Docs.param: Required. Resource group name of your recovery services vault.
Required. Name of your recovery services vault.
Required. Fabric name of the protected item.
Required. Name of the container where the protected item belongs to.
Required. Name of the protected item which has to be backed up.
Docs.summary: The Delete Protected Item Operation is used to disable protection of an item within a container. This operation marks the already existing protected item entity as not protected in the backend service. This is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether the backend service has finished processing the request, call the Get Item Operation Result API.
Docs.returns: Base recovery job response for all the asynchronous operations.

To determine whether the backend service has finished processing the request, call the Get Item Operation Result API.
Docs.returns: Base recovery job response for all the asynchronous operations.

Docs.param: Required. Resource group name of your recovery services vault.
Required. Name of your recovery services vault.
Docs.summary: Gets Info for the given item present in the given container specified by the names passed in the arguments. When the query parameter is used to pass the expand flag, this operation would return the extended info as well for the given item.This is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether the backend service has finished processing the request, call the Get Item Operation Result API.
Docs.returns: A single instance of a protected item response.
